definitions.definition: (physical) An area; somewhere within an area.
A location or position in space.
A particular location in a book or document, particularly the current location of a reader.
A passage or extract from a book or document.
A topic.
A frame of mind.
definitions.example: I'm in a strange place at the moment.

definitions.definition: A chess position; a square of the chessboard.
(social) A responsibility or position in an organization.
A fortified position: a fortress, citadel, or walled town.
Numerically, the column counting a certain quantity.
definitions.example: three decimal places;  the hundreds place

definitions.definition: Ordinal relation; position in the order of proceeding.
definitions.example: That's what I said in the first place!

definitions.definition: Reception; effect; implying the making room for.
To put (an object or person) in a specific location.
definitions.example: He placed the glass on the table.

definitions.definition: To earn a given spot in a competition.
definitions.example: The Cowboys placed third in the league.

definitions.definition: To remember where and when (an object or person) has been previously encountered.
definitions.example: I've seen him before, but I can't quite place where.

definitions.definition: (in the passive) To achieve (a certain position, often followed by an ordinal) as in a horse race.
definitions.example: Run Ragged was placed fourth in the race.

definitions.definition: To sing (a note) with the correct pitch.
To arrange for or to make (a bet).
definitions.example: I placed ten dollars on the Lakers beating the Bulls.

definitions.definition: To recruit or match an appropriate person for a job.
definitions.example: They phoned hoping to place her in the management team.

definitions.definition: To place-kick (a goal).
